title: LandMark White auditor casts doubt on viability
text:
LandMark White's auditors have cast doubt about the valuation firm's ability to keep trading despite the recent capital raising and directors' assurances of a return to profitability by the end of this calendar year.

The ASX-listed valuer published its annual report on Tuesday, confirming the full-year after-tax loss of $15.1 million that it reported last month and repeating the directors' statement that they expected LandMark White's revenue and profitability to have returned to a level permitting "appropriate" returns to shareholders by year-end.

Tim Rabbitt was confirmed as chief executive of LandMark White last month.

But while the directors also referred to the over-subscribed $5.44 million capital raising and said they had prepared detailed cashflow forecasts through to June 2020 that showed the company could pay its debts as and when they fell due, William Buck partner Leo Tutt said concerns about LandMark White's viability remained.

"A material uncertainty exists that may cast significant doubt on the companyʼs ability to continue as a going concern," Mr Tutt wrote.

"Our opinion is not modified in respect of this matter and, therefore, the consolidated entity may be unable to realise its assets and extinguish its liabilities in the normal course of business and at the amounts stated in the financial report."
